thread.title: NFL.com report: Steelers C Maurkice Pouncey expected to have another surgery
thread.title_full: NFL.com report: Steelers C Maurkice Pouncey expected to have another surgery

title: NFL.com report: Steelers C Maurkice Pouncey expected to have another surgery
text:
Posted: 1:49 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015 NFL.com report: Steelers C Maurkice Pouncey expected to have another surgery Related Photo credit: The Associated Press Maurkice Pouncey injury Sponsored Links PITTSBURGH — 
Pittsburgh Steelers All-Pro center Maurkice Pouncey is experiencing complications from his ankle injury and is expected to undergo another surgery, according to an NFL.com report . 
According to NFL Media’s Rand Getlin, it’s feared Pouncey will miss more of the season that initially anticipated. #Steelers OL Maurkice Pouncey is experiencing complications from his ankle injury, is expected to undergo another surgery, sources said. — Rand Getlin (@Rand_Getlin) October 15, 2015 While Pouncey is currently on IR, designated to return, there are fears that he may miss more of the season than initially anticipated. — Rand Getlin (@Rand_Getlin) October 15, 2015 
Pouncey suffered a broken bone in his ankle on Aug. 23. 
He underwent surgery to repair the break and was placed on IR with the designated to return tag on Sept. 6. 
This means he must spend at least six weeks on the team’s reserve/injured list before he’s eligible to practice. 
The earliest Pouncey could return to game action is Week 9 when the Steelers host the Oakland Raiders. 
The Steelers host the Arizona Cardinals Sunday at Heinz Field. Kickoff is set for 1 p.m. Sign up for our WPXI-TV Sports Newsletter Sign Up
